text: Wiślna Street (Polish: Ulica Wiślna, lit. Vistulan Street) - a historic street in Kraków, Poland. The street's name originates from 1311. The street runs from the Main Square towards the River Vistula (Wisła). The street extends southwards as Zwierzyniecka Street (Ulica Zwierzyniecka, lit. Smart Street). ==Features== {| |----- bgcolor="#FF 8C 00" ! width=4% | Street No. ! width=26% | Short description ! width=10% | Picture |----- bgcolor="#FFF8E1" | align="center"| 1 || align="center"| Czeczotka House - a Renaissance townhouse built in 1561 according to architects Gabriel Słoński and Ambroży Moroś's designs. The third floor was built in the nineteenth-century. || align="center"| 100px |} ==References== Category:Streets in Kraków
title: Wiślna Street, Kraków
